questions.question: He is ………………….. than I expected.
questions.description: Later is the comparative form of late.

questions.question: He is ……………………… than prudent.
questions.description: When we compare two descriptions, we use more.

questions.question: Janet is prettier than ……………………….. in the class.
questions.description: When two objects are compared with each other, the latter term of comparison must exclude the former.

questions.question: The ………………………. chapters are not very interesting.
questions.description: Latter is the opposite of former.

questions.question: Ours is the ………………………… house on this street.
Have you heard the ……………………….. news?
questions.description: Latest is used to talk about very recent things.

questions.question: She thinks her new job is much better than the ……………………. one.
questions.description: Last can mean the one before this one.

questions.question: This is the ……………………. warning you get from me.
Were you at the meeting ……………………. Monday?
questions.description: The expressions last month, last week, last Monday etc. are used without articles and prepositions.

questions.question: He is much ……………………. than his wife.
questions.description: We use old, older and oldest to talk of age.

questions.question: This is the ……………………….. mosque in India.
questions.description: Elder and eldest are used only of persons, not of animals or things.
